comments:
This course focuses on powerful general techniques for designing randomized algorithms as well as specific representative applications in various domains, including approximation algorithms, cryptography and number theory, data structure design, online algorithms, and parallel and distributed computation.

Students generally heaped praise on the course. One called it the “most amazing and intense learning experiences.” Most students enjoyed the course greatly. While many felt that the concepts were complicated, they thought that Professor Khanna was able to explain them in great clarity.

Overall, students regarded Professor Khanna as “excellent” and felt that his excitement was contagious.

Most students felt that assignments were challenging and demanding, but not excessive. CIS 320 is a prerequisite for this course.

This course review is based on the 6 student comments that were submitted.
